author: David Shultz
description: Hurricane Sandy moved a lot of debris, but where did it all end up?
title: Underwater Robot Tracked Ocean Sediment During Hurricane Sandy

author: Catherine Minnehan
description: Researchers look at previous Walker circulation models and ask, Does damping truly matter?
title: Rethinking How Tropical Convection Works

author: Chris Palmer
description: Since the mid-20th century, increased urbanization along the southern California coast has raised nighttime temperatures, resulting in less morning fog and cloud cover.
title: Urbanization Threatens Drought-Reducing Clouds in California

author: Mark Zastrow
description: What business do elves have in the upper atmospheres of gas giants? Plenty, it seems. The enormous ring-shaped phenomena triggered by lightning may occur on Jupiter, Saturn, and exoplanets.
title: Gaseous Planets May Have Huge Luminous Rings Caused by Lightning

author: Eric Betz
description: New technology could help scientists understand how experimental floods from Glen Canyon Dam restore sandbars downstream.
title: Using Sound Waves to Study Grand Canyon Sediment

author: Catherine Minnehan
description: The properties of terrestrial gamma ray flashes have eluded scientists for years. This new study sheds light on how they originate.
title: Newly Discovered Properties of Elusive Gamma Ray Flashes

author: Catherine Minnehan
description: Scientists find a solution to a 200-year-old problem: syncing the prominent bulges on the Moon with our natural satellite's origins.
title: How Did the Moon Get Its Shape?

author: Terri Cook
description: New satellite data highlight the important role African dust plays in maintaining the rain forest's long-term health.
title: Amazon Rain Forest Nourished by African Dust

author: Mark Zastrow
description: At the edge of Earth's magnetic field, satellites have found X-shaped fields and fast-moving "islands" of magnetism that could shed light on the physics of solar storms.
title: X Marks the Spot of Magnetic Islands in Space

author: Puneet Kollipara
description: Long-period oscillations in rainfall make even long records less useful for predicting future extremes.
title: Rainfall Fluctuations Hinder Projections of Future Extremes
